com.inrix.sdk

Class IncidentUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.inrix.sdk.IncidentUtils

  • public class IncidentUtils
extends Object
    Contains static methods that are useful in managing incidents.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      IncidentUtils()

    • Constructor Detail

      • IncidentUtils

        public IncidentUtils()

    • Method Detail

      • isRoadClosure

        public static boolean isRoadClosure(Integer eventCode)
        Returns whether an event code is a road closure, per ISO 14819-1:2003.
        Parameters:
        eventCode - The event code.
        Returns:
        true if the event code is a road closure; otherwise, false.

      • getDefaultComparator

        public static Comparator<Incident> getDefaultComparator()
        Gets the default incidents comparator for sorting for alerts. This comparator gives priority to most important incidents first, then prioritizes them by distance.
        Returns:
        The default comparator for alerts.

      • getDefaultListComparator

        public static Comparator<Incident> getDefaultListComparator()
        Get default incidents comparator for sorting for displaying incidents in a list. This comparator prioritizes them by distance first, then gives priority to most important incidents.
        Returns:
        The default comparator for displaying in a list.

      • getDefaultFilter

        public static IFilter<Incident> getDefaultFilter()
        Gets the default filter. This filter excludes Incident.IncidentType.CONSTRUCTION and Incident.IncidentType.UNKNOWN incidents.
        Returns:
        The default filter.

      • getIncidentFilter

        public static IFilter<Incident> getIncidentFilter(@NonNull
                                  Set<Incident.IncidentType> incidentTypesAllowed)
        Get a custom filter which can selectively allow incidents.
        Parameters:
        incidentTypesAllowed - A set of Incident.IncidentTypes that should return true when IFilter.isItemAllowed(T) is called.
        Returns:
        A custom Incident filter.
